level.text: A foster parent shall maintain records on each foster child placed in the home. All information regarding a foster child shall be kept confidential and released only in accordance with ยง 6023.
A foster child’s records shall include the following information:
The foster child’s name, birth date, and Medical Assistance number;
The name, address, and telephone number(s) of each person to contact in case of emergency and each person authorized to give medical consent;
A record of the foster child’s medical and dental appointments, illness and health problems, prescribed medications, and hospitalizations;
Reports of the foster child’s medical tests and any information or counseling received regarding chronic and handicapping conditions;
A copy of any service agreement for the foster child;
Dates of future Court or administrative reviews, any medical or other appointments, and planned activities;
The dates that the foster child arrived at and departed from the foster home;
A listing of the activities in the foster child’s case plan for which the foster parent is responsible;
A record of the foster child’s memberships, activities, and participation in extracurricular activities.
